title: How to Make a Strawberry Bundt Cake

steps.headline: Place the crushed strawberries on the bottom of the bundt pan.
Sprinkle the entire package of jello powder over the berries.
Place all of the mini marshmallows over the crushed strawberry and jello layers.
Prepare the cake mix according to the package instructions.
steps.description: Pour the cake mixture on top of the strawberry and marshmallow layers.

steps.headline: Bake in a 350ºF/180ºC oven for 50 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Serve.
steps.description: You can either serve it with whipped cream or prepare the icing by yourself. However you wish! Make the icing if using: Mix the confectioners' sugar, soft butter, and strawberry juice in a saucepan. Boil for 2 to 3 minutes. Drizzle over warm cake. Add fresh strawberries and cream if you'd like. If not, the cake tastes just as great without these extras!

text: Place the crushed strawberries on the bottom of the bundt pan.  Sprinkle the entire package of jello powder over the berries.  Place all of the mini marshmallows over the crushed strawberry and jello layers.  Prepare the cake mix according to the package instructions. Pour the cake mixture on top of the strawberry and marshmallow layers. Bake in a 350ºF/180ºC oven for 50 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Serve. You can either serve it with whipped cream or prepare the icing by yourself. However you wish! Make the icing if using: Mix the confectioners' sugar, soft butter, and strawberry juice in a saucepan. Boil for 2 to 3 minutes. Drizzle over warm cake. Add fresh strawberries and cream if you'd like. If not, the cake tastes just as great without these extras! Finished.
